snippet: Pressure built on the candidate to withdraw from the presidential campaign as party leaders urged the G.O.P. to shift its focus to down-ballot contests....
abstract: Dozens of Republican leaders withdraw support for Donald Trump following release of 2005 video showing him speaking about women in vulgar terms, dealing significant blow to his campaign; Trump's running mate Indiana Gov Mike Pence does not defend Trump's comments and urges him to turn situation around during second presidential debate with Hillary Clinton.

byline.original: By JONATHAN MARTIN, MAGGIE HABERMAN and ALEXANDER BURNS
byline.contributor: Jonathan Martin reported from Washington, and Alexander Burns and Maggie Haberman from New York. Ashley Parker and Patrick Healy contributed reporting from New York, and Thomas Kaplan from Indianapolis.

lead_paragraph: Pressure built on the candidate to withdraw from the presidential campaign as party leaders urged the G.O.P. to shift its focus to down-ballot contests.

headline.main: Lewd Donald Trump Tape Is a Breaking Point for Many in the G.O.P.
headline.print_headline: Lewd Trump Tape Is Breaking Point for Many in G.O.P
